item.title: 特朗普获胜促使澳大利亚养老基金增加私人信贷
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老金和财富管理公司之一 Colonial First State 计划加速推进私人信贷投资，以对冲唐纳德-特朗普潜在的通胀政策。【原文：Colonial First State, one of Australia’s largest pension and wealth managers, plans to accelerate its push into private credit investments to hedge against potential inflationary policies of Donald Trump.】

item.title: 水务行业陷入困境，英国南方水务公司评级被降至 "垃圾 "级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将南方水务有限公司（Southern Water Ltd.）的评级下调至垃圾级，并警告说，鉴于英国自来水和污水处理公司面临的困境以及该公司自身的不良记录，其评级可能会进一步下降。【原文：Southern Water Ltd. was downgraded to junk status by Moody’s Ratings and warned ratings could drop further in light of the woes facing UK water and sewage companies plus the company’s own weak track record.】

item.title: OMV 就 2022 年天然气争端从俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom）获得 2.3 亿欧元赔偿金
item.description: OMV AG 表示，该公司从俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）获得了一笔 2.3 亿欧元（2.43 亿美元）外加成本和利息的赔偿金，这笔赔偿金与 2022 年的天然气交付有关，从而提高了利润，并使未来从俄罗斯的采购面临风险。【原文：OMV AG said it has received an award for €230 million ($243 million) plus costs and interest from Gazprom PJSC related to gas deliveries in 2022, boosting profit and risking future procurements from Russia.】

item.title: 刚果与国际货币基金组织就 29 亿美元的新融资达成协议
item.description: 在国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）工作人员同意支持与中非国家合作的两项新贷款计划之后，刚果民主共和国将在未来三年内获得近 29 亿美元的资金。【原文：Democratic Republic of Congo is set to receive nearly $2.9 billion in financing over the next three years after International Monetary Fund staff agreed to support two new loan programs with the Central African nation.】

item.title: Element Capital 在大选前持有 20 亿美元的 S&P 500 ETF
item.description: 杰夫-塔尔平斯（Jeff Talpins）的元素资本管理公司（Element Capital Management）在追踪 S&P 500 指数的交易所交易基金中持有股份，到 9 月底价值约 20 亿美元。【原文：Jeff Talpins’ Element Capital Management built a stake in exchange-traded funds tracking the S&P 500 that was worth about $2 billion at the end of September — trades that paid off when Donald Trump recaptured the White House.】

item.title: 因旗下顶级品牌销售额下降，Vans 所有者 VF 被降至垃圾级
item.description: Vans 和其他品牌的所有者 VF Corp. 周三被 S&P Global Ratings 评为垃圾级，原因是其前四大品牌的收入在第二季度持续下降。【原文：VF Corp., the owner of Vans and other brands, was cut to junk by S&P Global Ratings Wednesday as revenues for its top four brands continued falling in the second quarter.】

item.title: 美国财政年度伊始医疗支出预算缺口扩大
item.description: 本财年伊始，美国预算赤字进一步扩大，主要原因是债务利息成本激增放缓，导致医疗和国防开支增加。【原文：The US budget deficit widened further at the start of the fiscal year, driven primarily by higher spending on health and defense as a surge in debt-interest costs slowed.】

item.title: 美联储穆萨莱姆认为如果通胀持续下降将逐步降息
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆表示，该央行有望实现通胀和就业目标，但他强调，在物价增长仍高于美联储2%的目标时，官员们应保持政策的 "适度限制性"。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said the central bank is within sight of its inflation and employment goals, but he underscored officials should keep policy “moderately restrictive” while price growth remains above the Fed’s 2% target.】

item.title: Leerink Partners 从古根海姆和 Gordon Dyal 聘请银行家
item.description: 据知情人士透露，医疗保健咨询公司 Leerink Partners 最近继续从古根海姆证券公司（Guggenheim Securities）和戈登-戴尔公司（Gordon Dyal & Co.【原文：Leerink Partners, the health-care advisory firm, has continued a recent recruitment drive with hires from boutiques Guggenheim Securities and Gordon Dyal & Co., people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美国码头工人再次取消谈判，自动化成为议题
item.description: 上个月，美国东部和南部海岸的各大港口都停止了货运，美国码头工人工会已取消了与雇主就自动化问题进行的谈判。【原文：The US dockworkers’ union that halted cargo at every major port on the country’s eastern and southern coasts last month has called off talks with their employers over the issue of automation.】

item.title: 大选结果推动市场反弹，美股抛售加剧

item.title: PG&E 项目旨在缓解人工智能计算需求和住房短缺问题
item.description: 加州公用事业巨头 PG&E 公司计划与一家开发商合作，在圣何塞市中心建设一个零碳数据中心和住宅项目，以满足硅谷日益增长的住房和人工智能计算需求。【原文：California utility giant PG&E Corp. plans to partner with a developer to build a zero-carbon data center and residential project in downtown San Jose to meet Silicon Valley’s growing demands for housing and artificial-intelligence computing.】

item.title: 摩根大通凯利称特朗普关税将打击经济增长，加剧通货膨胀
item.description: 摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）的大卫-凯利（David Kelly）表示，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）激进的关税计划可能会放缓全球经济，并给美国通胀带来上行压力。【原文：JPMorgan Asset Management’s David Kelly said President-elect Donald Trump’s aggressive tariff plans would likely slow the global economy and put upward pressure on US inflation, flagging risks that have largely been overshadowed during the stock market’s post-election rally.】

item.title: 意大利电信盈利符合预期，债务目标指日可待
item.description: 意大利电信公司（Telecom Italia SpA）公布的季度收益达到了分析师的预期，并重申了其减债目标，原因是巴西的增长以及云计算和网络安全服务需求的上升。【原文：Telecom Italia SpA posted quarterly earnings that met analyst estimates and reaffirmed its debt reduction targets on growth in Brazil and rising demand for cloud and cybersecurity services.】

item.title: 星巴克下调评级至 "卖出"，Redburn 警告经济复苏之路崎岖不平
item.description: 当星巴克公司任命布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）领导反弹工作时，华尔街一片欢呼。三个月后，当 Redburn Atlantic 告诉投资者抛售这家咖啡连锁店的股票时，欢呼声渐渐消失了。【原文：Wall Street applauded when Starbucks Corp. named Brian Niccol to head a rebound effort. Three months later, the cheers are fading as Redburn Atlantic tells investors to dump the coffee chain’s shares.】

item.title: 马克龙警告欧洲正驶向与美国和中国的关税战
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙警告说，欧洲有可能因唐纳德-特朗普的经济政策而分裂，并同时陷入与华盛顿和北京的贸易战。【原文：Emmanuel Macron warned that Europe risks getting divided by Donald Trump’s economic policy and being thrown into a simultaneous trade war with Washington and Beijing.】
